basics.name: Liam Naddell
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Liam Naddell is a 15 year old computer programmer from North Carolina who enjoys langauges like Golang, Rust, C, and Haskell. Alongside programming langauges, I have also learned technologies like Docker and Linux distributions like Gentoo, Fedora, Centos, ArchLinux, Linux From Scratch as well as Ubuntu and Debian.

volunteer.position: Technical Help for a Minecraft Camp
volunteer.summary: Amplified Learning Center is an institution focused on helping kids excel in the classroom environment.
highlights: Write a mock-up of a Minecraft curriculum for integrating coding and fun in order to get kids interested in coding
Reimage twelve computers to Antergos linux due to the fact that the operating system that came with the computers was unable to run Minecraft in any meaningful way

education.institution:
Dual Enrollment in Belmont Abbey College
August 2018

awards.title: LPI-Essentials
awards.summary: The LPI-Essentials exam tests if participants can work their way around a Linux system. It tests the competency of the test-takers in the linux booting process, the differences between distributions, popular open source technologies as well as basic GNU utilities.

awards.title: LPIC-1
awards.summary: Scheduled to take the LPIC-1 exam in June 2018
